WorkItem.Description:
I have the Dreamless Belt with the Ebonsteel Belt Buckle on it. The gems I have socketed are Veiled Demonseye and Rigid Ocean Sapphire. The regular Rawr display (both offline--b4.0.19--and online) properly shows both the built-in gem socket and the belt buckle socket. However, when I run Optimize either offline or online, it only displays one socket and suggests Brilliant Inferno Ruby, and if I accept the changes, the display shows both sockets containing the ruby.
 
One time when I did the optimization, it appeared to suggest Veiled Demonseye and when I accepted the changes, it showed Veiled Demonseye and Brilliant Inferno Ruby. So I believe that it is actually recommending two gems but only displaying the built-in one.
 
I have attached a screenshot of the offline optimization results.

Comments.Message: You need to read the posting guidelines and actually attach your character xml file so that we can see what you are seeing. At the very very very basic minimum you have to tell us what class and spec you are.
Sorry. I was a bit tired at 3:00am and as it was I re-wrote my post several times. My character is a Draenei mage in Fire spec. My Rawr character file is attached.

I'm having the same issue on my Fire Mage.  Mine's going from Brilliant Inferno Ruby to Veiled Demonseye in the native socket, but ignoring the buckle socket.  As Palladia's screenshot shows, it's showing as "Not Enchanted" on both the pre and post panes.

As a correction to anyone else that's posting, it's NOT IGNORING THE SOCKET..... It's just not displaying it on the results screen. When you load the new set, the socket will be filled with whatever it determined during the optimize.

At least I didn't start a whole new ticket, right?  >.>

Thanks for your help, Jothay.  :)
Providing an additional Character sheet that reproduces same display error.
